page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN BERWICK
page.content: Berwick is on the main East Coast railway from London to Edinburgh via Newcastle. 12 passenger trains per day call at Berwick on their way north, 13 on the way south.There are about 50 passenger trains using the line each day, but very few goods trains.The main goods yard at Tweedmouth is almost closed.It is used by coal merchants,a builders'merchant and as a waste collection area.The branch line to Cornhill was closed in 1963.The route is partly a footpath,partly the E.Ord by-pass and partly farmland. The main A1 trunk road used to run through Berwick,causing traffic problems in the Town centre.A by-pass, opened in Oct.1983,now takes through- traffic around the Town and nearby villages.The route is 8.7km long,uses a new bridge but caused loss of some farmland.Few people were disturbed.
